unnormalised: ## My Brush with Digital Banking – A Reality Check!
normalised: My Brush with Digital Banking – A Reality Check!

unnormalised: So, I thought I was all cool and tech-savvy, right? Paperless statements, UPI payments, the whole nine yards. I even bragged to my mom about how I hadn't visited a bank branch in, like, forever. Famous last words, I tell you! It all started innocently enough, with a message from "SBI" on 02/11/2023 about updating my KYC. I clicked on the link (yes, I know, huge mistake!), and bam! It asked for my net banking login ID and password.
normalised: So, I thought I was all cool and tech-savvy, right? Paperless statements, U-P-I payments, the whole nine yards. I even bragged to my mom about how I hadn't visited a bank branch in, like, forever. Famous last words, I tell you! It all started innocently enough, with a message from "S-B-I" on second november two thousand and twenty three about updating my K-Y-C. I clicked on the link (yes, I know, huge mistake!), and bam! It asked for my net banking login I-D and password.

unnormalised: Being the genius I am, I entered it. Within 5 mins, I received a series of OTPs, followed by transaction alerts. My heart sank faster than the value of crypto these days. Rs. 50,000, then another Rs. 25,000… gone! Vanished into the digital ether. Panic set in. Chai wasn't calming me down.
normalised: Being the genius I am, I entered it. Within five minutes, I received a series of O-T-P-s, followed by transaction alerts. My heart sank faster than the value of crypto these days. Rupee fifty thousand, then another rupee twenty five thousand… gone! Vanished into the digital ether. Panic set in. Chai wasn't calming me down.

unnormalised: The next few hours were a blur of frantic calls to the "customer care" number (which, surprise, surprise, turned out to be fake), changing all my passwords, and mentally kicking myself for falling for such an obvious scam. I remembered reading an article that said nearly 60% of online banking frauds originate from phishing attempts like these. And here I was, a statistic.

unnormalised: Finally, I managed to reach the real SBI customer care. They were helpful, but the process was slow. They blocked my account, but the money was already gone. They advised me to file a police complaint, which I did at the cybercrime cell in my city on 03/11/2023. It was a whole day wasted, and the chances of recovering the money seemed slim.

They advised me to file a police complaint, which I did at the cybercrime cell in my city on third november two thousand and twenty three. It was a whole day wasted, and the chances of recovering the money seemed slim.

unnormalised: The police inspector, a surprisingly tech-savvy guy named Sharma, explained that these scammers are incredibly sophisticated. They use spoofed numbers that mimic bank numbers. He said that around 75 cases are reported per month in this district alone. He took down my account details: Savings Account No. XXXXXXXXXXXX1234. I hope he finds those criminals quickly.
normalised: The police inspector, a surprisingly tech-savvy guy named Sharma, explained that these scammers are incredibly sophisticated. They use spoofed numbers that mimic bank numbers. He said that around seventy five cases are reported per month in this district alone. He took down my account details: Savings Account Number X-X-X-X-X-X-X-X-X-X-one-two-three-four. I hope he finds those criminals quickly.

unnormalised: What's worse, they even accessed my other accounts, including my Paytm wallet. I found out that someone had tried to make a purchase of Rs 2,000 through it. Thank God, I got an alert right in time, and managed to block that transaction.
normalised: What's worse, they even accessed my other accounts, including my Paytm wallet. I found out that someone had tried to make a purchase of rupee two thousand through it. Thank God, I got an alert right in time, and managed to block that transaction.

unnormalised: It’s been a wake-up call, to say the least. I'm now ultra-paranoid about any message claiming to be from a bank or financial institution. I've also started using a password manager and enabled two-factor authentication on every single account I own. The convenience of digital banking is amazing, but the risks are very real.

I've also started using a password manager and enabled two-factor authentication on every single account I own. The convenience of digital banking is amazing, but the risks are very real.

unnormalised: So, learn from my mistake, folks. Double-check everything, never click on suspicious links, and always, always be skeptical. It's better to be safe than sorry, especially when your hard-earned money is at stake. I'm still recovering from the financial and emotional hit, but I'm determined to be smarter and more careful from now on. And maybe, just maybe, I'll start visiting my bank branch again, just to stay grounded.
